ToggleEvent.summary: The ToggleEvent interface represents an event that fires when a popover element is toggled between being shown and hidden.

remarks.para: This is the event object for the and events, which fire on elements as follows:

ToggleEventNewState.summary: The newState read-only property of the interface is a string representing the state the element is transitioning to.
ToggleEventNewState.value: A string. Possible values are "open" (the popover is being shown) or "closed" (the popover is being hidden).

ToggleEventOldState.summary: The oldState read-only property of the interface is a string representing the state the element is transitioning from.
ToggleEventOldState.value: A string. Possible values are "open" (the popover is going from showing to hidden) or "closed" (the popover going from hidden to shown).

ToggleEventSource.summary: The source read-only property of the interface is an object instance representing the HTML popover control element that initiated the toggle.
ToggleEventSource.value: An object instance, or null if the popover was not activated by a control element.

ToggleEventToggleEvent.summary: The ToggleEvent() constructor creates a new object.
